business.headline: Retail inflation declines to 6-year low of 3.16% in AprilRetail inflation dropped to a six-year low of 3.16% in April 2025 from 3.34% in March, thanks to cheaper vegetables, fruits, pulses, and protein-rich food.

Old vs new tax regime: Should your home loan decide for you?Home loan benefits are important, but they aren't the only ones to think about. Other deductions under the old regime, like Section 80D (health insurance), Section 80G (donations) and HRA (House Rent Allowance), also make a difference.

Sensex ends 1,282 points lower, Nifty below 24,600; Infosys down nearly 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 1,281.68 points to end at 81,148.22, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 346.35 points to close at 24,578.35.

Nissan reports loss of $4.5 billion amid financial woesNissan Q4: This is one of the biggest yearly losses in the company's history and a major drop compared to the previous year's net profit of 426.6 billion yen.

'Staying invested and staying patient': Radhika Gupta's advice after market surgeIndian stock markets surged over 3.7% on May 12, their strongest performance in nearly a year. The rally came after a ceasefire agreement between India and Pakistan over the weekend, along with positive signals from global markets and strong mutual fund inflows.

Crypto platforms asked to track J&K transactions for money laundering: ReportOver the last year, exchanges have made crypto withdrawals more restrictive, requiring users to provide more information about who is receiving the funds and why. These measures aim to curb misuse, given the anonymous and borderless nature of crypto.

Gold recovers as US-China tariff truce spurs bargain-buyingSpot gold was up 0.6% at $3,254.39 an ounce, as of 0639 GMT. Bullion recorded a 2.7% decline in the previous session. US gold futures GCcv1 were up 1% at $3,258.70.

Sensex drops over 1,200 points, but here's why you shouldn't panicThe market pulled back from the gains made in the last session. The Sensex dropped over 1,000 points in early trade, and Nifty also slipped as investors booked profits.

Yes Bank shares continue to rally, up 4% today. Buy, sell or hold?The stock has now climbed nearly 19% in just five trading sessions and 21% in a month, but top brokerages remain unconvinced. Most still have a 'sell' or 'neutral' rating on the lender.

ITR Filing 2025: All 7 forms out, key changes taxpayers must knowOne big change this year affects salaried individuals and small business owners who earn long-term capital gains (LTCG) from listed shares or mutual funds. If the gains are up to Rs 1.25 lakh a year, they can now file returns using ITR-1 or ITR-4 forms.

Explained: Why Swiggy shares fell up to 7% to hit 52-week low todaySwiggy shares have fallen around 45% since the beginning of the year. Over the past month, the stock has dropped 10%, and in the last three months, it has declined by 18%.

Tata Motors to announce Q4 results today. Here's what to expectTata Motors stock: The company's share price fell nearly 1% during morning trade on Tuesday. It opened at Rs 720.55 and dropped to a day's low of Rs 714.35 as investors showed caution ahead of the results.

entertainment.headline: Anna Camp sparks romance rumors with stylist Jade Whipkey on InstagramAnna Camp appears to be dating stylist Jade Whipkey, as social media posts, TikToks, and public displays hint at a romantic connection. Neither party has officially confirmed the relationship.

Cassie testifies against Diddy: "Freak offs became a job" in sex trafficking trialCassie delivered harrowing testimony in Diddy's sex trafficking trial, alleging years of abuse, coercion, and control. The court viewed damning video evidence as the trial against the music mogul intensifies.

Sitaare Zameen Par trailer: Aamir Khan returns with an uplifting new storyAamir Khan's new film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' trailer has been released, showcasing a heartwarming story. The film promotes inclusivity and introduces fresh talent, creating high expectations among audiences.

Hina Khan recreates iconic Goblin scene with Rocky Jaiswal during South Korea tripTelevision star Hina Khan is currently exploring South Korea, recreating iconic K-drama scenes with Rocky Jaiswal at the locations where they were filmed.

Tom Cruise jumps from 10,000 feet in Mission Impossible - Final Reckoning stuntTom Cruise shared BTS video from 'Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning', showcasing his stunt training for 10,000 feet jump from airplane. The film, releasing on May 23, 2025, marks the franchise's epic finale.

Amar Kaushik to direct Lust Stories 3 with Vikramaditya Motwane: ReportDirector Amar Kaushik will join Vikramaditya Motwane, Kiran Rao, and Shakun Batra to direct a short film in Netflix's upcoming 'Lust Stories 3'. This will mark Kaushik's first project outside his usual horror-comedy genre.

Alia Bhatt to postpone her Cannes debut amid India-Pak tensionActor Alia Bhatt is set to postpone her Cannes debut this year due to tensions between India and Pakistan. The actor was set to attend the festival on its opening day, May 13.

Kartik Aaryan shares pic with Sreeleela as they wrap schedule of Anurag Basu's filmKartik Aaryan shared a picture with Sreeleela from the sets of their upcoming film by Anurag Basu. The two shared their excitement as they wrapped a schedule of the film.

Kapil Sharma's Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2 to release in September: ReportKapil Sharma will return with 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2', which is likely to release on September 26, 2025. The date will mark exactly 10 years since the release of the original film.

Battleground: Rounak Gulia, Nikhil Singh emerge winnersThe 'Battleground' finale took place on May 10, where Rounak Gulia and Nikhil Singh were announced as the winners in the female and male categories, respectively.

Akshay Kumar, Suniel Shetty and Shilpa Shetty's Dhadkan to re-release in theatresPopular romantic film 'Dhadkan', starring Akshay Kumar, Suniel Shetty, and Shilpa Shetty, is set to re-release in theatres on May 23 in a digitally remastered format.

French actor Gerard Depardieu convicted of sexual assaultFrench actor Gerard Depardieu has been convicted of sexually assaulting two women on a film set. The verdict marks a significant moment in addressing misconduct in the French film industry.

The Office spinoff The Paper announced, to premiere in September'The Office' fans globally have a reason to rejoice as the new spinoff, 'The Paper', has been officially announced. The series will feature fresh cast members, promising to bring back the beloved humour and charm.

Simi Garewal to make Cannes red carpet debut for Aranyer Din Ratri screeningVeteran actor Simi Garewal is set to make her Cannes red carpet debut. She will be attending the screening of the 4K restored version of Satyajit Ray's film 'Aranyer Din Ratri' (1970).

Brec Bassinger shares favourite death sequence in Final Destination franchiseFinal Destination: Bloodlines actor Brec Bassinger spoke about her experience of joining the Final Destination franchise, which is making a return after 15 years. The actor also spoke about the massive production scale of the film.

Nawazuddin Siddiqui skips watching House before Indian adaptationNawazuddin Siddiqui reveals he hasn't watched the original 'House MD' series before starring in the Indian adaptation. He aims to maintain originality and avoid influences while focusing on his passion-driven career.

Namaste India! Tom Cruise meets influencers Jannat Zubair, Avneet Kaur in LondonHollywood star Tom Cruise recently met Jannat Zubair and Avneet Kaur in London ahead of 'Mission Impossible- The Final Reckoning'.  The film is set to release in India on May 17.

Lee Do-hyun discharged from military service: What's Next for Korean actor?South Korean actor Lee Do-hyun has been officially discharged from his military service after 21 months. His return to the entertainment industry is expected to bring new projects and rekindle his rising career.

All smoke, no screen time: How The Royals wasted Zeenat Aman's comebackVeteran actor Zeenat Aman makes her much-anticipated comeback in Netflix's 'The Royals', but her return leaves fans disheartened. Read to find out how her presence was reduced to ornamental screen time.

general news.headline: Not enough being said about Kashmiris killed in Pak shelling: Omar AbdullahSpeaking to India Today TV, Omar Abdullah expressed disappointment at what he termed a "lack of national attention" to the deaths of citizens of Jammu and Kashmir caused by Pakistan's cross-border shelling.

Watch India Today special: Operation Sindoor reconstructed using AIIndia Today TV's special report on Operation Sindoor, using AI, reconstructs the daring, covert 100-hour Indian military mission that eliminated over 100 terrorists across nine cross-border camps with precision airstrikes, sending a powerful message of deterrence.

New Delhi rejects Trump's claim on India-Pak ceasefire, says trade never came upThe Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) clarified that the Indian and US leadership were in touch during the tense standoff with Pakistan, but there was no conversation on trade.

BJP Minister's 'Pak' remark for Colonel Sofiya Qureshi backfires: What he saidThe MP tribal welfare minister's comments appeared to be an attempt to eulogise PM Modi over Operation Sindoor; the Congress has demanded his resignation

Sindoor tests India's ties with Trump's QuadWhile India waged a war on Pakistan-sponsored terror through Operation Sindoor, her so-called Quad allies ghosted her in real time. US President Donald Trump's diplomacy visibly turned the Quad from a strategic alliance into a WhatsApp group chat, leaving messages unread. The Quad's silence is bizarre as Pakistan is nothing more than a frontline Chinese province, and the grouping was formed with an eye on China.

Cop says Padma Shri scientist couldn't swim: Suicide, accident or foul play?Police say Padma Shri scientist Dr Subbanna Ayyappan could not swim, yet his body was recovered from the Cauvery River. With no injuries or CCTV, the case raises troubling questions.

Bengaluru man asks 'why no one's bombing PM Modi's house' in video, arrestedA Bengaluru-based man was arrested for posting a provocative video on social media calling for a bomb attack on Prime Minister Modi's residence. He was traced by police and sent to Parappana Agrahara jail.

Trump to lift sanctions on Syria in 'chance at greatness' to countryUS.President Donald Trump on Tuesday announced plans to lift all sanctions on Syria, aiming to normalise relations and give the country's new government "a chance at peace".

Sitaare Zameen Par trailer: Aamir Khan returns with an uplifting new storyAamir Khan's new film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' trailer has been released, showcasing a heartwarming story. The film promotes inclusivity and introduces fresh talent, creating high expectations among audiences.

India expels Pak High Commission staffer over activities outside official roleThe move came amid heightened tensions between New Delhi and Islamabad following Operation Sindoor targeting terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied-Kashmir after the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack.

Son of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh's wife from her first marriage found deadPritam Majumdar, the 26-year-old son of BJP leader Dilip Ghosh's wife from a previous marriage, was found dead in Kolkata on Tuesday.

Meet Kashish Chaudhary, Balochistan's first Hindu woman Assistant CommissionerKashish Chaudhary, accompanied by her father Girdhari Lal, met Balochistan Chief Minister Sarfaraz Bugti in Quetta and told him that she would work for the empowerment of women and minorities, and the overall development of the province.

Over 24k get over 95%, nearly 2 lakh over 90%: CBSE marks losing their meaning?Over 24,000 Class 12 students scored above 95% in the CBSE results 2025, while over 1.1 lakh students crossed the 90% mark. The numbers are even higher in CBSE Class 10 with nearly 2 lakh students scoring above 90%. But are these high marks truly meaningful, or are we just going through the motions?

What nuclear, fighting was always conventional: India junks Trump's claimIndia firmly rejected US President Donald Trump's claim of averting a nuclear conflict with Pakistan, asserting that the military action between the neighbours remained strictly conventional.

Canada names Anita Anand foreign minister: What to know about her Indian rootsAnita Anand has been named Canada's new Foreign Minister in PM Mark Carney's Cabinet reshuffle. A former Defence and Transport Minister, Anand is known for her work on Ukraine aid and military reform.

Operation Sindoor: The historic 100 hours reconstructed using AI. WatchDays after Operation Sindoor concluded, we at India Today, with the help of artificial intelligence (AI), and a team of graphics artists, military and strategic experts, have recreated the operation.

There's life before Kailash Mansarovar and there's life after. What's yours?As the unmissable pilgrimage to the Tibet region resumes this year, here's an experiential piece from a pilgrim setting out what this year's probable yatris will see and the consolation for those who have missed applying.

UK tightens work visa, citizenship norms. 5 top pointsBritish PM Keir Starmer attributed many of the UK's problems to immigration. This was followed by several stringent regulations on study, work and family visas. The policy change will impact Indians applying for work, stay and studies in the UK. Here are the top five points from the new regulations.

Ghar mein ghus kar maarenge: PM says no place in Pak where terrorists can hideReiterating India's aggressive policy on cross-border terrorism, PM Modi said that "the Armed Forces will enter the homes of terrorists and strike."

Congress slams BJP leader's 'vulgar, insulting' remarks on Col Sofiya QureshiBJP leader Vijay Shah allegedly made objectionable comments about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi, who was among the officials representing the armed forces during the briefing on Operation Sindoor.

Alia Bhatt to postpone her Cannes debut amid India-Pak tensionActor Alia Bhatt is set to postpone her Cannes debut this year due to tensions between India and Pakistan. The actor was set to attend the festival on its opening day, May 13.
How to tailor skincare to your needsFrom K-beauty to old-school solutions, the best skincare isn't about what's trending but what keeps your skin healthy and happy

Saudi Arabia to invest $600 billion in US, signs $142 billion arms dealTrump punched the air as he emerged from Air Force One to be greeted by Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who later signed an agreement with the US President which Saudi state television said covered energy, defence, mining and other areas.

Indian student arrested in US, conned elderly couple of $50K with child-porn ruseAn Indian student in the US who scammed a Michigan couple of $50,000 by claiming their credit card was used to purchase child pornography, was arrested. The police suspect the money has been routed to India.
This is the fourth such arrest in three weeks, as Indian students have been arrested for targeting elderly Americans in fraud schemes.

Anna Camp sparks romance rumors with stylist Jade Whipkey on InstagramAnna Camp appears to be dating stylist Jade Whipkey, as social media posts, TikToks, and public displays hint at a romantic connection. Neither party has officially confirmed the relationship.

sports.headline: Why did you retire? Watch heartbroken fan confront Virat Kohli at airportVirat Kohli was confronted by a fan at Mumbai airport a day after announcing his retirement from Test cricket. Kohli announced his retirement from Test cricket, drawing the curtains on a stellar red-ball career.

Cristiano Ronaldo delighted as 14-year-old son debuts for Portugal U15 vs JapanCristiano Ronaldo was beaming with pride as his 14-year-old son, Cristiano Ronaldo Jr., made his debut for Portugal's U15 national team in a friendly match against Japan.

Sanjay Manjrekar shocked by Test captaincy rumours, strongly backs BumrahFormer India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar has expressed disbelief at reports suggesting Jasprit Bumrah was not the frontrunner to replace Rohit Sharma as India's next Test captain.

Mohammed Shami quashes retirement rumour ahead of England Test squad selectionIndia tour of England: Fast bowler Mohammed Shami has been struggling for rhythm in IPL 2025, managing just 6 wickets in nine matches for SunRisers Hyderabad. India's Test squad for the tour of England is set to be picked in the third week of May.

Carlos Alcaraz joins Nadal in elite list, completes Masters 1000 quarter setCarlos Alcaraz joined his idol Rafael Nadal on the elite list after earning a hard-fought win over Karen Khachanov to storm to the quarter-finals at the 2025 Italian Open. Alcaraz has now reached the quarter-finals at all nine Masters 1000 tournaments.

Preity Zinta slams troll over Glenn Maxwell marriage joke: Stop the gender biasPreity Zinta confronted a sexist troll who questioned Glenn Maxwell's performance in IPL 2025. She called for greater respect towards women and highlighted the persistent gender bias in sports and on social media.

Carlo Ancelotti proud of unforgettable years at Real MadridCarlo Ancelotti on Tuesday reflected with pride on his second spell at Real Madrid, calling it a remarkable four-year journey filled with unforgettable moments.

Pat Cummins likely to return as BCCI talks to boards on player availabilityIPL 2025: Pat Cummins and Travis Head are expected to return to SunRisers Hyderabad for the remainder of the season, resuming May 17. The BCCI has been in touch with foreign boards over availability of players.

South Africa coach reacts to IPL 2025 extension: Want our players back on May 26Despite the extended Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season and its resumption on May 17, South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad has made it clear that his players must report back in time to prepare for the World Test Championship (WTC) 2025 Final.

Shubman Gill has good brain: Moeen Ali backs GT skipper to lead Indian Test sideFormer England all-rounder Moeen Ali has backed Shubman Gill to captain India in the upcoming Test series in England beginning from June 20. Rohit Sharma's retirement has left India's Test captaincy spot vacant.

Chamari Athapaththu fined 10 percent match fee for breaching ICC Code of ConductSri Lanka women's cricket team captain Chamari Athapaththu has been fined ten per cent of her match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during tri-series fixture against South Africa.

Carlo Ancelotti proud of unforgettable years at Real MadridCarlo Ancelotti on Tuesday reflected with pride on his second spell at Real Madrid, calling it a remarkable four-year journey filled with unforgettable moments.

Pat Cummins likely to return as BCCI talks to boards on player availabilityIPL 2025: Pat Cummins and Travis Head are expected to return to SunRisers Hyderabad for the remainder of the season, resuming May 17. The BCCI has been in touch with foreign boards over availability of players.

South Africa coach reacts to IPL 2025 extension: Want our players back on May 26Despite the extended Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season and its resumption on May 17, South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad has made it clear that his players must report back in time to prepare for the World Test Championship (WTC) 2025 Final.

Shubman Gill has good brain: Moeen Ali backs GT skipper to lead Indian Test sideFormer England all-rounder Moeen Ali has backed Shubman Gill to captain India in the upcoming Test series in England beginning from June 20. Rohit Sharma's retirement has left India's Test captaincy spot vacant.

Chamari Athapaththu fined 10 percent match fee for breaching ICC Code of ConductSri Lanka women's cricket team captain Chamari Athapaththu has been fined ten per cent of her match fee for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct during tri-series fixture against South Africa.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
